newsitem.title: GERMANY: Rexrodt urges Airbus to adhere to deadline.
newsitem.headline: Rexrodt urges Airbus to adhere to deadline.

text.p: German Economics Minister Guenter Rexrodt called on Monday for the Airbus consortium partners to implement their restructuring plan on schedule to compete against the prospective merger between Boeing and McDonnell Douglas Corp.
"The partners must not stop half way," Rexrodt said in a statement. "Considering the concentration process in the U.S., the time plan must be stuck to."
Rexrodt's comment came after Airbus Industrie announced that its four European partners had signed a memorandum of understanding to restructure Airbus into a limited liability company by 1999.

Toulouse-based Airbus is currently a partnership between French state-owned Ste Nationale Industrielle Aerospatiale, British Aerospace Plc, Daimler-Benz Aerospace(DASA), and Construcciones Aeronauticas SA (CASA) of Spain.
Germany has been a keen backer of the restructuring plan, and Rexrodt said any delays in its implementation would lead to losses in competitiveness which would damage the European aerospace industry.
"All four partners must bring their significant productive assets into the new company," his statement continued.
